definitions.definition: a group of things of the same type that grow or appear close together

examples.text: The telescope is focused on a dense cluster of stars at the edge of the galaxy.
The plant bears its flowers in clusters.
a leukaemia cluster *(= an area where there are more cases of the disease than you would expect)*
Doctors are worried about what appear to be cancer clusters occurring in these areas.
The bacteria form clusters in the gut of the host animal.
The plants have clusters of white flowers in early June.

definitions.definition: a group of people, animals or things close together

examples.text: The church stood in a small cluster of houses.
A woman had emerged from the cluster of buildings.

definitions.definition: a group of consonants that come together in a word or phrase, for example /str/ at the beginning of string

wordOrigin: Old English clyster; probably related to clot.
